name: Makati Shangri-La Manila

reviews.text: This is a very short review because this is quite simply the best hotel in the World. I have stayed in good hotels over my 40 years travelling and this is the first place I have stayed where I don't have a single complaint, even a minute one.
reviews.title: Simply the best there is

likes.liked: — Everything - this is a very classy hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.text: If you are travelling to Manila and you don't stay here, you are missing an experience.
reviews.title: Incredible

likes.liked: — Afternoon tea at the Horizon Club

reviews.text: What a place! Everything from the moment you walk through the front doors is perfection. I'm not usually into staying in such fancy hotels, but this place was incredible. Definitely the best hotel in the Philippines.
reviews.title: #1 for good reason! Love the Shang!

reviews.text: The Shangri-La is #1 for a reason. It's absolutely the best hotel in Manila. Location is fantastic, right in the center of Makati with a wide range of shopping and restaurants right outside the door.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay @ Makati Shangri-La

reviews.text: Even though the room decor hasn't changed in several years, it's so well-maintained that you'd think they just updated it. Service is tops, they're so attentive and welcoming. Restaurants inside the hotel are great too, be sure to check out Circles buffet breakfast...yum!
reviews.title: Oh, alright - pamper me!

likes.liked: — Professional staff, great breakfast, great gym, close to shopping areas
likes.disliked: — Some inconsistencies with food on weekend breakfast or dinner buffet

reviews.text: I checked-in to the Shangri-La after checking out of the Hyatt Casino in Malate (see my review of that hotel elsewhere).
reviews.title: A Great Location for Business and Night Life!

likes.liked: — Comfortable with all that you could want to hand.
likes.disliked: — The rooms need bringing up to date,; they're a little tired!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you have picked up your jaw from the luxurious pile of the circular carpet in the most amazing lobby, you head towards the check-in desks on the right. The image that you are greeted with is five-start opulence.!
reviews.title: simply The Best

likes.liked: — The room was spotless and felt warm and friendly, the wood panelling and curved walls are so much nicer than some of the very modern hotels with a minimal look

reviews.text: The staff are impeccable dressed in their smart uniforms, everyone is so polite. Walk in through the front doors and they are opened with a ‘Good afternoon sir!’ Immediately walk out again and they say ‘Good afternoon sir – have a nice day!’ Then turn a walk in again and you are greeted with another ‘Good afternoon sir!’
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Once you are shown into the luxurious lifts (elevators) you choose your floor and steal yourself for the experience of your room.
reviews.title: Beware of the nocturnal activities

reviews.text: It's a bit of an anti-climax!
reviews.title: Wow...

likes.liked: — great rooms, great staff, great facilities...
likes.disliked: — maybe a bit too decadent, but if you can get over your guilt...

reviews.text: I stayed in the Shangri La Makati for 2 nights from July 7 thru July 9. I must say that this is an excellent hotel with great amenities and excellent service from the front desk to housekeeping. I can't say enough how friendly the staff is. Even the Security (military I think) while attending to their serious duties took every opportunity to smile and greet all guests at the lobby (maybe to deflect their presence). Felt very secure but wondered why there was so much security in the first place. I greatly enjoyed the breakfast buffet although I couldn't partake in all the different kinds of cuisine! I wish I could stay all day and taste everything! Some of the bathroom fixtures were a little worn and dated but it did not deter the enjoyment of my stay there. The room is well-appointed and clean. You will not be disappointed. This is a top rated hotel in a great location. I was not able to try their spa as it was undergoing renovations so I went to "The Spa" in Greenbelt I. I also highly recommend this spa. I hope they don't raise the prices as this makes me all the more feel great about their services. Excellent massages and facials and I was really impressed with their facilities.
reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations

reviews.text: Nice big rooms with expansive use of blond woods and enough space for a sitting area & couch. While the room design is undoubtedly contemporary, it is a business hotel and so kind of uninspiring… but supremely comfortable all the same. Service is exceptional (as you would expect in the Philippines), and the food at the in-house restaurants is very good (I had a surprisingly good steak). Facilities are good – there are two pools, the larger of which is quite massive, and I could see two tennis courts from my window. Location in the heart of Makati is very good with shopping all around.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in central Manila

reviews.text: What problems if any…? Mold in the bathroom – in the shower and around the toilet. It’s not that hard to keep away and to my mind it’s unacceptable in top quality hotel. Otherwise, faultlessly good.
reviews.title: First class service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fab hotel we went there direct from the Pan Pacific in Singapore, this hotel is in the business district so dont expect a beach!! ,the staff make this hotel even better than it is, they are so polite, we had an Horizon room on the 23rd floor you have access to computers and your own lounge, have a look at a web site for other benefits, the buffet meals are great the cost around 3,600 peso for buffet breakfast for 3 people which is around £41 massive choice and all very nice, ours was included in the expedia booked package, the pool is okay its outside on the 4th floor ok for kids, nice gym and tennis courts. Its well worth a look Rod and family U.K.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in great location, but

likes.disliked: — Hustle and bustle at breakfast restaurant, room rate

reviews.text: Somehow accidentally, my husband and I spent three nights at the Makati-Shangri-la (actually we were on our way from Taipei to Shanghai via Manila, where they told us, that we would need a visa for entering Shanghai - we did not know that, because we've been to Hongkong and Macau before, where we always got a tourist visa on arrival -; that's why we ended up at Manila.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: We spent one night there using their holiday rate. We stayed at their deluxe room, used the spa, had airport limo pick up and drop off and ate at their restaurant. Emails were responded to within 24 hours.
reviews.title: Wished we had stayed longer.

reviews.text: 1) Room: 5/5 with comfortable beds, 2 types of robes (japanese style and terry cloth), little extras like bath salts, "art" lights (mini bar turns on), (2) complimentary bottles of water, flashlight, umbrella, free shoe shine etc.
reviews.title: Good but very expensive

likes.liked: — The high quality of the food

reviews.title: Robbery in the business centre
reviews.text: 2) Spa - 5/5 I used their spa next to the gym since they have 24 hour spa service. They come to your room as an option for the same price. Tip: from 10 am to 3 pm, they have 30% discount. The only downside was that my masseuse talked too much but that is only a minor irritation. The rooms have showers, it was beautifully decorated and their tea was delicious. (7 herbs). The price was right with a discount.
3) Limo service - 5/5, 2 bottles of water, cold towels, professional service, new cars. Overpriced as expected but it was worth the convenience. Use only as a perk.
reviews.title: The best hotel ever

likes.disliked: — the bathroom had mold on the ceiling

reviews.text: 4) Extras: 5/5 for security and customer service. We had no complaints and there was security cameras everywhere. The corridors was well lit and had airconditioning. Tried the restaurant in the lobby. It was not bad. I would give it a 3/5 for food and 5/5 for ambience. They had a tennis court, their gym had new equipments and they also had a hair salon on site.
reviews.title: Exceptional Property and Service

description: Makati Shangri-La, Manila is located at the center of Manila's most prestigious business, shopping and entertainment district. Just 20 minutes away from the international airport, this award-winning hotel offers exquisite comfort and world class luxury. From its exceptionally spacious and beautifully appointed rooms to its lavish restaurants and exciting bars, its high-speed internet access to its full-service Spa and Fitness Center, Makati Shangri-La lives up to its reputation as Manilas leading hotel.
